src:
Žuželka Greta in Trg Tomaž
Trga Tomaža Pengova ni, je pa zato svet dobil žuželko z imenom Nelloptodes gretae.
07 Nov 2019, 12:16 by Dejan Vodovnik



Ekologistka, po kateri so imenovali žuželko. FOTO: Reuters



Tomaž Pengov, po katerem niso imenovali trga v Ljubljani. FOTO: RTV Slovenija


Jebelacesta, sem zavzdihnil oni dan, ko sem prebral, da je novoodkritega hrošča medene barve odkritelj poimenoval po mladi švedski okoljski aktivistki Greti Thunberg. Entomolog Michael Darby iz Prirodoslovnega muzeja v Londonu se je namreč odločil za ime Nelloptodes gretae. »Ime sem izbral, ker je delo mlade aktivistke name naredilo velik vtis, zato bi se rad poklonil njenemu izjemnemu prispevku pri okoljskih vprašanjih,« je pojasnil Darby, ki je hrošča iz poddružine rodu Ptinidae odkril med približno 22 milijoni primerkov v zbirki Prirodoslovnega muzeja v britanski prestolnici. Nelloptodes gretae je dolg manj kot milimeter ter nima oči in kril. V šestdesetih letih minulega stoletja so ga pobrali iz prsti v Nairobiju, so sporočili iz londonskega muzeja. Vodja zbirke hroščev Max Barclay je pojasnil, da na odkrit­je čaka še več sto primerkov teh žuželk – v muzejskih zbirkah ali na prostem po svetu. Nekatere bodo zaradi krčenja biotske raznovrstnosti verjetno izumrle, še preden jih bodo popisali.No, sem si rekel, res je hudič s temi poimenovanji. Le kaj bi si mislile dežurne tercijalke in dežurni dušebrižniki, če bi kaka od še več sto primerkov žuželk, ki čakajo na odkritje v zbirki Prirodoslovnega muzeja v Londonu, dobila ime po kakem slovenskem estradniku. Npr. Tanji Žagar? Viliju Resniku? Roku Švabu? Modrijanih ali Veselih planšarjih? Vendar takih in podobnih odkritij naši univerzitetni javno-zasebni predavatelji in znanstveniki še niso odkrili. Imajo veliko več dela sami s seboj in s svojimi espeji in zaslužki za lasten žep … No, vendar je to neka druga zgodba.In spet k imenovanjem in poimenovanjem. O tem, kakšne politične igrice so se dogajale ob imenovanju ene od ulic v Ljubljani, je znano, vendar naj bo pozabljeno. Ne glede na to, da zapleti niso bili posledica »privška«, ampak ker se je imenovanje ulice znašlo v nekem političnem paketu in ker vemo, da s politiko pač ni dobro češenj zobati, je pač nekaj časa ostalo na ledu imenovanje ulice – ene prvih te vrste v glavnem mestu – po slovitem slovenskem glasbeniku Jožetu Privšku.Kot vemo, letošnje leto med drugim mineva tudi v znamenju sedemdesetletnice rojstva slovenskega kantavtorja Tomaža Pengova, ki se je tako z glasbo kot z besedo že s prvencem Odpotovanja vpisal v zgodovino slovenske ustvarjalnosti. Joj, koliko lepih besed je bilo izrečenih na njegov račun in v njegov spomin.Kot vemo, je lani ljubljanska mestna oblast razgrnila namero, da ulice na območju AKC Metelkova mesto uradno poimenuje in s tem izniči neuradno ime južnega dela Metelkove, namreč Trg brez zgodovinskega spomina. V predlogu Odloka o določitvi imen ulic, parkov, trgov in sprememb potekov ulic na območju Mestne občine Ljubljana je Komisija za poimenovanje naselij in ulic na predlog Društva slovenskih pisateljev v gradivu predlagala, da se trga na novo imenujeta: Trg Jureta Detele in Trg Tomaža Pengova. No, pa se je zataknilo. AKC Metelkova je namreč sama od sebe poimenovala del svoje cone Trg brez zgodovinskega spomina, ki izhaja, kot so povedali, iz zgodovinskega koncepta dogajanja pred 25 leti. Pa se je oglasila še izbranka naroda, ki zastopa Levico, Nataša Sukič: »V Levici smo prepričani, da je kakršno koli preimenovanje trgov znotraj avtonomne cone brez soglasja Foruma AKC Metelkova mesto v nasprotju z dobrimi praksami civilnega dialoga in participiranja zainteresirane javnosti pri odločitvah javnega pomena,« je mogoče razbrati iz magnetograma 35. seje mestnega sveta Mestne občine Ljubljana. Svetnica je tudi poudarila, svetniki pa so ji verjeli, da je poimenovanje trgov znotraj AKC Metelkova mesto torej stvar odločitev omenjene avtonomne cone, zato je pozvala mestne svetnice in svetnike, da podprejo amandma in se tako iz akta izloči predlagano poimenovanja trgov. Z večino glasov ji je to tudi uspelo.No, tako. Trga Tomaža Pengova zato ni, je pa zato svet dobil žuželko z imenom Nelloptodes gretae. In priznati jo morajo tudi člani Foruma AKC Metelkova mesto, ki jih, za vraga, o tem ni nihče nič vprašal!

Insect Greta and Tomaz Square
There is no market for Thomas Peng, but the world has been given an insect called Nelloptodes gretae.
07 Nov 2019, 12:16 by Dejan Vodovnik



An ecologist named after the insect. PHOTO: Reuters



Tomaž Peng, after which they did not name the market in Ljubljana. PHOTO: RTV Slovenia


Jebelacesta, I sighed the other day when I read that the newly discovered honey beetle was named after the young Swedish environmental activist Greta Thunberg. Entomologist Michael Darby of the Natural History Museum in London has decided to name Nelloptodes gretae. "I chose the name because the work of a young activist made a great impression on me, so I would like to pay tribute to her outstanding contribution to environmental issues," explained Darby, who discovered some 22 million specimens from the Ptinidae subfamily in the Museum of Natural History in the British capitals. Nelloptodes gretae is less than a millimeter long and has no eyes or wings. In the 1960s, it was picked up from soil in Nairobi, according to the London Museum. Head of the Beetle Collection Max Barclay explained that hundreds more specimens of these insects are awaiting discovery - in museum collections or in the open air around the world. Some will probably become extinct due to biodiversity loss before they are inventoried. Well, I told myself, it's really the devil with those names. What would the tertiary caretakers and on-duty nutritionists think if one of the hundreds of other insect specimens awaiting discovery at the Museum of Natural History in London was named after a Slovenian entertainer. E.g. Tanji Žagar? Willie Resnik? Roku Swab? Wise or Happy Mountaineers? However, such and similar discoveries have not yet been discovered by our university public-private lecturers and scientists. They have a lot more work to do with themselves and with their espees and earnings for their own pocket ... Well, but that's another story. And again, the names and the names. What is known about the political games that took place during the naming of one of the streets in Ljubljana, but it should be forgotten. Notwithstanding that the complications were not due to the "attachment", but because the street name was part of a political package and because we know that the policy is not good to cherry-pick, it has remained on the ice for some time that the street name - one of the first According to the famous Slovenian musician Jože Privšek, we know that this year is also marking the seventieth anniversary of the birth of Slovene singer-songwriter Tomaž Peng, who has made a name for himself in the history of Slovene creativity with both music and words. Oh, how many beautiful words have been uttered on his account and in his memory.As we know, last year the Ljubljana city government announced its intention to officially name the streets in the AKC Metelkova City area, thus eliminating the unofficial name of the southern part of Metelkova, namely the Square without a historical of memory. In the proposal of the Decree on the name of streets, parks, squares and changes in the course of streets in the City of Ljubljana, the Commission for Naming Settlements and Streets proposed by the Slovene Writers Association to rename the markets: Jure Detele Square and Tomaž Peng Square . But it stuck. Namely, AKC Metelkova named a part of its Square without historical memory, which, as they said, is derived from the historical concept of events 25 years ago. Natasa Sukic, a spokeswoman for Levica's nation, said: "In Levica we are convinced that any renaming of markets within the Autonomous Zone without the consent of the AKC Metelkova City is contrary to the good practices of civil dialogue and public participation in public decisions. meaning, "can be seen from the magnetogram of the 35th session of the City Council of the City of Ljubljana. The councilwoman also stressed that councilors believed that naming markets within the AKC Metelkova City was therefore a matter for the decisions of the aforementioned Autonomous Zone, and therefore urged city councilors and councilors to support the amendment, thus removing the proposed market names from the act. She did it with the majority of votes. Well, that's right. There is no market for Thomas Peng, but the world has been given an insect called Nelloptodes gretae. And it must be acknowledged by members of the AKC Metelkova City Forum, who the hell no one asked about it!
